DataElement.preferredName: Investigator Study Site Research Personnel Role Postal Address ISO21090.AD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A researcher at a study site who oversees multiple aspects of the study at a site, including protocol submission for IRB approval, participant recruitment, informed consent, data collection, and analysis. A contact point used to send physical forms of communication to the study site personnel.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Investigator Study Site Research Personnel Role Postal Address
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.:A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted.:People engaged in research.:The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event._A physical location used by a person or organization for the purpose of receiving postal mail deliveries.

Concepts.definition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.
A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted.
The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event.
